title: The Everlasting Problem (2020)
description: Health insurance for millions of Americans is dependent on their jobs. But it's not like that everywhere. So how did the U.S. end up with such a fragile system that leaves so many vulnerable—or with no health insurance at all? On this episode, how a temporary solution created an everlasting problem.

itunes:title: The Everlasting Problem (2020)
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: The United States has the most expensive health care system in the world. It doesn't have to be this way — so why is it?
itunes:subtitle: The United States has the most expensive health care system in the world. It doesn't have to be this way — so why is it?
